The claim states that in 2009: Julián Castro received a seven-figure referral fee from personal injury lawyer Mikal Watts. The expert's verdict confirms that Castro did receive a substantial referral fee from Watts, but this occurred when Castro was in private practice, not while he was serving as mayor.
The expert: s verdict includes a timeline of Castro's career, which shows that he served as mayor of San Antonio from 2009 to 2014. This timeline supports the claim that Castro received the referral fee in his first year as mayor, but it also emphasizes that the fee was earned before he took office as mayor.
